content.question: Country 2015 Real Gross Domestic Product <math alttext="open parenthesis, G D P, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>GDP</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> Population X 490,000 70 Y 200,000 20 Which conclusion can be supported by the data in the table above?

choices.label: Country X’s real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> growth rate is 7 percent.
Country X’s real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per capita is $4,000.
Country X’s economy grew at a faster rate than Country Y’s economy did.
Income is more equally distributed in Country X than in Country Y.

Country Y’s real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per capita is greater than Country X’s real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per capita.

content.answer: Country Y’s real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per capita is greater than Country X’s real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per capita.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
